name: lacerate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
medical
  formal or specialized to cut or tear something, especially flesh: The sharp branches lacerated my bare arms. He was seen pushing the man into a wall, lacerating his chin.
literary to cause someone great emotional pain: To think of his own friends betraying him lacerated him. Their cruel laughter lacerated my heart.
formal to criticize someone or attack them with words in a very powerful way: Critics have lacerated the press for getting the facts wrong in this case. As a political cartoonist, he likes to lacerate the pompous and the powerful. Related words
lacerated
lacerating
